segments.en: And today we're going to be talking about a really common situation with parents.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论一个与父母非常常见的情况。

segments.en: Yeah, when you're a teenager you always need to ask your parents for money, ask your parents for the car, or ask your parents if you can do something.
segments.cn: 是的，当你是青少年时，你总是需要向父母要钱、要车，或者问父母是否可以做某事。

segments.en: Exactly, and that's what we're going to be looking at, is how you can ask for permission for the car, for money.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要讨论的就是如何请求父母的许可，借车或要钱。

segments.en: Right, and these phrases are not only for your parents, right?
segments.cn: 对，这些短语不仅适用于你的父母，对吧？

segments.en: No, you could use them in your office, with your boss, or for any situation where you need to ask politely.
segments.cn: 不，你可以在办公室用它们，对你的老板，或者在任何需要礼貌请求的场合。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们来看一下词汇预览。

segments.en: We have one word for you today.
A concert is an event, right?
segments.cn: 音乐会是一个活动，对吧？
人们在演奏音乐的地方。

segments.en: So you have different types of concerts, like a rock concert.
segments.cn: 所以你有不同类型的音乐会，比如摇滚音乐会。

segments.en: Or even a classical music concert.
Exactly, where you have people playing violins and pianos.
segments.cn: 没错，那里有演奏小提琴和钢琴的人。

segments.en: So concerts are always for music.
segments.cn: 所以音乐会总是与音乐有关。

segments.en: Well, with that, let's go into our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来我们进入对话。

segments.en: Well, basically we have a teenage girl who needs to go to a concert and is asking her dad for something.
segments.cn: 基本上我们有一个需要去音乐会的少女，正在向她的父亲请求一些东西。

segments.en: By the way, I was wondering, can I... No.
segments.cn: 顺便问一下，我在想，我可以... 不。

segments.en: I haven't even told you what it is yet.
segments.cn: 我还没告诉你是什么呢。

segments.en: Do you think I could borrow the car?
I'm going to a concert tonight.
I need the car tonight to pick up your mother.
segments.cn: 我今晚需要车去接你妈妈。

segments.en: Ugh, I told you about it last week.
segments.cn: 哼，我上周就告诉过你了。

segments.en: Smelly Toes is playing and Eric asked if I would go with him.
segments.cn: Smelly Toes乐队要演出，Eric问我是否愿意和他一起去。

segments.en: Duh, he's like the hottest and most popular guy at school.
segments.cn: 哼，他是学校里最帅、最受欢迎的男孩。

segments.en: Would you mind giving me 100 bucks?
Yeah, they're always asking for something.
segments.cn: 是的，他们总是要些什么。

segments.en: Yeah, this brings back memories, but I'll tell you about that later.
segments.cn: 是的，这让我想起了过去，但我稍后再告诉你。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at the vocabulary in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不看看语言要点中的词汇呢。

segments.en: All right, we've got a few interesting words here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们这里有几个有趣的单词。

segments.en: So this is the superlative of hot.
Right, so the hottest guy in school is... The most handsome.
segments.cn: 对，所以学校里最帅的男孩是... 最英俊的。

segments.en: Yeah, the most sexy guy in school.
segments.cn: 是的，学校里最性感的男孩。

segments.en: So if somebody is hot, they are really attractive.
segments.cn: 所以如果某人很hot，他们真的很有吸引力。

segments.en: Um, and so Marco, is this a word that is only used for men?
segments.cn: 嗯，Marco，这个词只用于男性吗？

segments.en: No, you can also use it for women.
segments.cn: 不，你也可以用它来形容女性。

segments.en: You know, recently with Paris Hilton, it's more popular with things like, wow, I got a new car.
segments.cn: 你知道，最近与Paris Hilton有关，这个词在形容东西时更流行，比如，哇，我买了辆新车。

segments.en: Um, but I guess we maybe should tell our listeners to be careful with this word.
segments.cn: 嗯，但我想我们也许应该告诉我们的听众小心使用这个词。

segments.en: Yeah, you don't really want to tell somebody you're hot.
segments.cn: 是的，你真的不想告诉某人你很hot。

segments.en: But with your friends, you can use this word.
segments.cn: 但在朋友之间，你可以使用这个词。

segments.en: If I'm talking with my friends and I see a girl like, wow, she's hot.
segments.cn: 如果我和朋友在一起，看到一个女孩，哇，她真漂亮。

segments.en: Yeah, but just don't tell her.
Yeah, don't go up to her and say, wow, you're hot.
segments.cn: 是的，别走上前对她说，哇，你真漂亮。

segments.en: Means having a lot of friends.
Having a lot of friends or being well-known.
segments.cn: 有很多朋友或被广泛认可。

segments.en: So in every school, there's always like the most popular guy in school, the most popular girl.
segments.cn: 所以在每个学校，总是有最受欢迎的男孩和女孩。

segments.en: Were you the most popular guy?
segments.cn: 你是最受欢迎的男孩吗？

segments.en: No, I wasn't the most popular guy, but I wasn't unpopular.
segments.cn: 不，我不是最受欢迎的男孩，但我也不算不受欢迎。

segments.en: So that was, uh, that was okay.
Well, this is a phrase made up of two simple words, but why don't we listen to some examples so we can understand the meaning of these two words together.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一句由两个简单单词组成的短语，但我们为什么不听一些例子，以便理解这两个单词的意思呢。

segments.en: If you won't go with me, I'll go by myself.
segments.cn: 如果你不和我一起去，我就自己去。

segments.en: If you want to break up, I don't care.
segments.cn: 如果你想分手，我不在乎。

segments.en: You want to go out with your friends?
segments.cn: 你想和你的朋友出去吗？

segments.en: So you would use this when you agree with somebody, but you're not really happy about it.
segments.cn: 所以你会在同意某人时使用这个，但你并不真的高兴。

segments.en: It's like saying I agree, but I'm really angry.
segments.cn: 就像是在说我同意，但我真的很生气。

segments.en: Maybe sometimes because you don't have a choice.
segments.cn: 也许有时因为你没有选择。

segments.en: So even though we have the word fine in there, it's not really a nice thing to say to someone.
segments.cn: 所以即使我们有“好吧”这个词，它对某人来说并不是一个好听的说法。

segments.en: No, this is definitely not one to use with your boss.
segments.cn: 不，这绝对不是对你的老板使用的。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue again, and then we'll talk about some more phrases.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们再讨论一些短语。

segments.en: By the way, I was wondering, can I... No.
segments.cn: 顺便问一下，我在想，我可以... 不。

segments.en: I haven't even told you what it is yet.
segments.cn: 我还没告诉你是什么呢。

segments.en: Do you think I could borrow the car?
I'm going to a concert tonight.
I need the car tonight to pick up your mother.
segments.cn: 我今晚需要车去接你妈妈。

segments.en: I told you about it last week.
Smelly Toes is playing, and Eric asked if I would go with him.
segments.cn: Smelly Toes乐队要演出，Eric问我是否和他一起去。

segments.en: He's like the hottest and most popular guy at school.
segments.cn: 他是学校里最帅、最受欢迎的男孩。

segments.en: Would you mind giving me 100 bucks?
There's a lot of phrases in this dialogue that we can use to ask for something, right?
segments.cn: 在这个对话中有很多短语可以用来请求东西，对吧？

segments.en: And in a very polite way.
segments.cn: 而且是非常礼貌的方式。

segments.en: So we're going to look at three ways of asking for something.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看三种请求东西的方式。

segments.en: And the first way is, I was wondering.
So I could say, I was wondering, can I borrow your car?
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，我在想，我可以借你的车吗？

segments.en: Or, I was wondering, can I stay at your house?
segments.cn: 或者，我在想，我可以住在你家吗？

segments.en: It's a very nice way to ask something.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常好的请求方式。

segments.en: It's like to begin a question.
Let's take a look at the next one.
And it's basically the same thing.
Do you think I could... Do you think I could...
segments.cn: 你觉得我可以... 你觉得我可以...

segments.en: Do you think I could... Do you think I could... ...borrow the car?
segments.cn: 你觉得我可以... 你觉得我可以... ...借车吗？

segments.en: Or, do you think I could use your computer?
segments.cn: 或者，你觉得我可以用你的电脑吗？

segments.en: I can say, I was wondering, can I use your computer?
segments.cn: 我可以说，我在想，我可以用你的电脑吗？

segments.en: Do you think I could use your computer?
segments.cn: 你觉得我可以用你的电脑吗？

segments.en: Now let's look at the last one.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看最后一个。

segments.en: So I could say, would you mind holding this for me?
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，你介意帮我拿这个吗？

segments.en: Or, would you mind finishing this report for me?
segments.cn: 或者，你介意帮我完成这个报告吗？

segments.en: Now there's an interesting thing here that you have the verb in gerund form, right?
segments.cn: 这里有个有趣的事情，你有动词的动名词形式，对吧？

segments.en: So we've got, I was wondering, can I do something?
segments.cn: 所以我们有，我在想，我可以做某事吗？

segments.en: And, would you mind doing something?
So you have the ing. Be very, very careful.
segments.cn: 所以你有 ing。要非常小心。

segments.en: Be sure to not say, would you mind to give me?
segments.cn: 确保不要说，你介意给我吗？

segments.en: So you would say, would you mind giving me?
segments.cn: 所以你应该说，你介意给我吗？

segments.en: Let's listen to some more examples of these three phrases.
segments.cn: 让我们听听这三种短语的更多例子。

segments.en: Would you mind cooking dinner tonight?
We were wondering if you could buy the tickets for us?
segments.cn: 我们在想你能为我们买票吗？

segments.en: Do you think you can have those reports finished by today?
segments.cn: 你觉得你能在今天完成那些报告吗？

segments.en: All right, so I think it's really clear now, and it's a very useful way of asking for things.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得现在很清楚了，这是一种非常有用的请求方式。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue for the third time, and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们第三次听我们的对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: By the way, I was wondering, can I... No.
segments.cn: 顺便问一下，我在想，我可以... 不。

segments.en: I haven't even told you what it is yet.
segments.cn: 我还没告诉你是什么呢。

segments.en: Do you think I could borrow the car?
I'm going to a concert tonight.
I need the car tonight to pick up your mother.
segments.cn: 我今晚需要车去接你妈妈。

segments.en: Ugh, I told you about it last week.
segments.cn: 呜，我上周就告诉过你了。

segments.en: Smelly Toes is playing, and Eric asked if I would go with him.
segments.cn: Smelly Toes乐队要演出，Eric问我是否和他一起去。

segments.en: He's like the hottest and most popular guy at school.
segments.cn: 他是学校里最受欢迎的男孩。

segments.en: Would you mind giving me 100 bucks?
So Marco, you said that this dialogue really brought back some memories for you.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，你说这个对话真的让你想起了一些回忆。

segments.en: Yeah, my dad was exactly the same way.
I would just say dad, and he would be like, no.
segments.cn: 我只要叫爸爸，他就会说，不行。

segments.en: So he would always cut me off before I ask anything.
segments.cn: 所以他总是在我问任何事情之前就打断我。

segments.en: Sounds like a pretty strict guy.
segments.cn: 听起来是个很严格的人。

segments.en: No, but it was a lot of fun.
Sometimes he would just say it just to make me angry or something like that.
segments.cn: 有时他只是为了让我生气而这么说。

segments.en: But it was difficult to get him to lend me the car, for example.
segments.cn: 但例如，借车对我来说很困难。

segments.en: Oh yeah, I mean he wouldn't just lend me the car.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，我的意思是他不会轻易借我车。

segments.en: And sometimes if he did lend me the car, then the next day he would be like, hey, you need to wash the car or something like that.
segments.cn: 有时如果他借我车，第二天他会说，嘿，你需要洗车之类的。

segments.en: So you had to pay him back.
I had to pay him back with something.
In my family, I was always allowed to borrow the car because we lived really, really far away from the city, so there were no buses or subway.
segments.cn: 在我家，我总是可以借车，因为我们住得离市区很远，所以没有公交车或地铁。

segments.en: But I always got to borrow the worst car, you know, the most terrible car.
segments.cn: 但我总是借到最糟糕的车，你知道的，最糟糕的车。

segments.en: Which led to so many problems, like my car stopping working in the middle of the street, which was never good.
segments.cn: 这导致了很多问题，比如我的车在街中间抛锚，这可不好。

segments.en: We did used to live a little bit further away from downtown, but we had a good bus system.
segments.cn: 我们确实住得离市中心有点远，但我们有很好的公交系统。

segments.en: So we'd just be like, take the bus, it's cheaper, stuff like that.
segments.cn: 所以我们就会说，坐公交车，便宜，类似的事情。

segments.en: So I didn't really get the car that often until I bought my own, or until I had a motorcycle of my own, and then problem solved.
segments.cn: 所以我并不常借车，直到我买了自己的车，或者直到我有了自己的摩托车，然后问题就解决了。

segments.en: All right, well, I want to know from our listeners, what did they ask for from their parents?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想知道我们的听众，他们向父母请求了什么？

segments.en: Did you ask for the car?
Or did you ask for a pony?
Did you ask for a pony?
I had a friend who had a summer home.
segments.cn: 我有个朋友有个夏季别墅。

segments.en: So he would ask for the keys to the summer home.
segments.cn: 所以他会问要夏季别墅的钥匙。

segments.en: Okay, well, come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
We want to hear from you.
We want to know what you think.
And Erika and I are definitely there to answer any doubts.
segments.cn: 而且我和Erika一定会回答任何疑问。

segments.en: All right, well, guys, thanks for listening.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，谢谢你们的收听。
